title: Ilaria D'Amico
text:
Ilaria D'Amico (born 30 August 1973) is a <a href="Color%20commentator%23Europe">commentator</a> and television host on Italian television. She is most known for her work on shows related to <a href="association%20football">football</a> in fact in June 2018 she left Italian Sky Sport.
Personal life.
As of 2014, D'Amico has been in a relationship with <a href="Juventus%20F.C.">Juventus</a> and former <a href="Italy%20national%20football%20team">Italian national team</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a> <a href="Gianluigi%20Buffon">Gianluigi Buffon</a>, following his separation from his wife <a href="Alena%20%C5%A0eredov%C3%A1">Alena Šeredová</a>. Prior to her relationship with Buffon, D'Amico had been in a relationship with Rocco Attisani, a real estate developer and entrepreneur, with whom she had a son, Pietro. In 2015, Buffon announced that he and D'Amico were expecting a child together, and on 6 January 2016, the couple announced, on <a href="Twitter">Twitter</a>, the birth of their son Leopoldo Mattia. D'Amico, as well as her partner Buffon, was one of over <a href="Endorsements%20in%20the%20Italian%20constitutional%20referendum%2C%202016%23Presenters%20and%20journalists">80 Italian celebrities to sign a petition in favour</a> of the <a href="Italian%20constitutional%20referendum%2C%202016">2016 referendum on constitutional reform</a>. In the summer of 2017, she and Buffon became engaged.
